created_at: let‚Äôs see what they say: Does Kingsdale/Viston expect to press release an update before the end of February when the remaining filing procedures have been completed? Aka when the only real remaining step in the process is determining the final tendered amount of shares? Does Kingsdale/Viston have access to the total number of shares currently held by brokers (such as my shares at RBC) and have at least a good estimate of how close to 50% (or even 90%) you are to the goal? This information (how many shares have indirectly been tendered aka tendered by the holder but not officially by the broker) could be very useful in swaying any on the fence shareholders who are currently spreading doubt about the offer on message boards. They often site the 144M shares tendered even though many people know that doesn‚Äôt include most broker held shares that number is still used to spread doubt. Thanks for your time.

body: $PQEFF The truth is
created_at: Petroteq never had any intentions of producing any oil from the tar sands.  Their business model was a proof of concept that it could be done cleanly with their technology.  I think they achieved that.  Now
column3: they are going to try to get as much money as they can by selling their technology.  It wouldn‚Äôt surprise me if they issued more stock for cash to investors.  I hope this sale goes through as I have 200K shares tendered many of which I paid only .02 cents/share but It wouldn‚Äôt surprise me if us shareholders get screwed.  I‚Äôve seen this scenario play out before with a company called Shrink Technologies.  They had a great idea and proved it would work with a solar  technology.  It couldn‚Äôt be put to practical use but the owners got rich and the shareholders got screwed.

body: The fact that they submitted the merger details to the SEC for blessing tells me that they intend to utilize the technology in the US as well as develop the resources they are acquiring here...
